Increase green space coverage to improve air quality
Promote public transportation to reduce vehicle emissions

summary.executive_summary: This urban planning simulation indicates moderate traffic congestion with moderate air quality. The total project cost is high, amounting to $15,000,000. The high traffic congestion combined with moderate air quality suggests a need for mitigation measures.
key_findings: Traffic flow shows moderate congestion with an average travel time of 18.7 minutes.
Total project cost estimated at $15,000,000 ($1,000 per capita).
Air quality is moderate with an Air Quality Index of 65.
Annual CO2 emissions estimated at 100,000 kg.
3 pollution hotspots identified requiring targeted mitigation.
recommendations: Implement traffic management measures to reduce congestion.
Consider public transportation improvements to reduce vehicle dependency.
Implement stricter emission controls for industrial zones.
Increase green space coverage to improve air quality.
Promote public transportation to reduce vehicle emissions.
Regular monitoring and reporting of key metrics.
Community engagement on planning decisions and impacts.
